title.narrative: 03-01 COMMUNITY WATER SUPPLY

description.narrative: 3.1. By 2021, Government and partners have strengthened national capacity to legislate, coordinate, plan, deliver and monitor equity based water supply interventions in peri-urban and rural areas, which contributes to Safe And Equitable Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Services And Practices, Wash And Emergencies, Water Supply, Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Systems And Empowerment Of Communities, Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Systems And Empowerment Of Communities (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 3. By 2021, children (including adolescents), and pregnant women, especially those from rural and peri-urban areas, benefit from improved and equitable access to and use of systems that deliver safe drinking water, improved sanitation and improved hygiene practices.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 3.1. By 2021, Government and partners have strengthened national capacity to legislate, coordinate, plan, deliver and monitorequity based water supply interventions in peri-urban and rural areas

description.narrative: UNICEF contributed to strengthening the WASH sector through its support for the implementation of the national action plan for improving drinking water quality monitoring and surveillance, and the national regulatory framework for drilling. An estimated 128,500 people in rural communities gained access to basic water supply, and services were sustained for over 6 million people in urban areas and for over 18,000 refugees. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:07/01/2022

title.narrative: Additional number of people who gained access to basic drinking water source(49319), Text
National regulatory framework for drilling sector is in place(43379), Text

baseline.value: No Regulatory frame work in place

target.value: 2022:SI is under implementation. A study to review the experiences of implementation of the SI is disseminated

title.narrative: National Water Quality Monitoring Protocol (NWQMP) is finalised and under implementation(43381), Text

target.value: 2022:NWQMP and National Water Quality Action Plans are launched and under implementation
